document_data.name: Lurker
document_data.mainbody: '''Lurkers''', otherwise known as '''lurkers above''', were a type of [[aberration]] found in the [[Underdark]].
document_data.Description: Lurkers physically resembled [[manta ray]]s but were much larger. Their underside was grey and had a texture similar to that of stone.
document_data.Behavior: Lurkers tended to stubbornly fight others to the point of death.
document_data.Biology: Lurkers flew due to a gas they naturally generated in internal sacs. This gas gave them a natural buoyancy, which they coasted upon by flapping their wing-like mass.
document_data.Abilities: Lurkers were nearly impossible to detect, thanks to their excellent camouflage.
document_data.Combat: Lurkers hunted by hiding along the top of caverns and tunnels, attaching themselves with their camouflaged underside facing downwards. Once a target passes underneath, it dropped from the ceiling, slamming into them and wrapping itself around its prey. It killed its prey by constriction.
document_data.History: In [[1357 DR]], lurkers could occasionally be found in the sewers beneath [[Waterdeep]].

Ecology.Diet: Lurkers were an omnivorous species and ate whatever they could manage.
Ecology.Usage: Lurkers were sought after to be trained and employed as defensive creatures. As such, lurker eggs could be sold for up to 900 [[gp]] and a newborn lurker up to 1,100 [[gp]]. The gas generated by lurkers could be used as a [[material component]] in the brewing of a ''[[potion of levitation]]''.
